intro: Gamochaeta rizzinii, commonly known as the slender false fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and sandy soils. It produces small, yellowish to white flower heads that are often surrounded by pale green bracts. Gamochaeta rizzinii is a perennial herb that is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
